docs.title: Component Selection
docs.text:
MOTOR CONTROL

Solution Pros Cons

Option 1 Fairchild FAN 8100N $1.16/ each Link to product

  • Fairly cheap
  • Already given from the class
  • DIP that is easy to mount to a PCB
  • Contains heat sinks
  • Fairly narrow operating voltage
  • Expensive shipping rates
Solution Pros Cons

Option 2 DRV8411 Dual H-Bridge Motor Driver $2.30/ each Link to product

  • Can be used for 1 or 2 motors
  • Wide range of operational voltages
  • More expensive
  • Slow shipping time
  • Requires a different setup on a PCB
Solution Pros Cons

Option 3 DRV8870 Brushed-DC Motor Driver $2.09/ each Link to product

  • Fairly small
  • Wide voltage operating range
  • Only operates one motor
  • Requires different PCB layout
  • Operating range lies outside of amount supplied by voltage regulator

Choice: Option 1: Fairchild FAN 8100N Rationale: The FAN8100N is already accessible to the team through the materials given throughout the year, saving on shipping costs, time, and the cost of the unit itself. Additionally, the H-bridge will easily slot into PCBs, and contains heat sinks to keep the part safe and minimize damage and potential replacement.

MOTOR

Solution Pros Cons

Option 1 Pololu 3483 Metal Gearmotor $35.95/ each Link to product

  • Able to provide good torque
  • Good RPM
  • Falls within operating necessities
  • Heavy
  • Somewhat expensive
Solution Pros Cons

Option 2 STANDARD MOTOR 6600 RPM 12V $2.75/ each Link to product

  • Very cheap
  • High RPM
  • Low Strength
  • Ideal Voltage is lower than 12V
Solution Pros Cons

Option 3 Portescap 17N78210E.1 Brushed DC Motor $141.02/ each Link to product

  • High RPM
  • Lightweight
  • Good Torque
  • Very expensive
  • Somewhat large

Choice: Option 1: Pololu 4754 Metal Gearmotor Rationale: The Pololu 4754 has the best features for the price. While the Portescap 17N78210E.1 likely outclasses it in terms of features, the significantly higher price is too much. Conversely, although option 2 is much less expensive, it likely will not be able to handle the necessary operations to complete the project.

Voltage Regulator

Solution Pros Cons

Option 1 Taejin LM7805T $0.33/ each Link to product

  • The team already has these
  • The team already has experience with them
  • Good input voltage range
  • Can only be bought in quantities of 100
  • Very high shipping costs
Solution Pros Cons

Option 2 L7805CV $0.50/ each Link to product

  • Very similar to the component we are familiar with
  • Dynamic pricing making it cheaper at high quantities than other options
  • Multiple options to regulate voltage to
  • Higher cost for fewer ICs, especially with the amount we would need.
Solution Pros Cons

Option 3 TSR 1-2450E $3.40/ each Link to product

  • High input voltage range
  • Able to regulate down to 3.3 or 5v
  • Most expensive
  • Uses an unfamiliar setup

Choice: Option 1: Taejin LM7805T Rationale: This product is the easiest to design the project with, since the team has access and experience with it already. However, in the event of needing to change parts or get replacements, the L7805CV may be a better option. Until those replacements are needed, however, the LM7805T remains the best option.

Pushbutton

Solution Pros Cons

Option 1 TS02-66-43-BK-260-LCR-D $0.10/ each Link to product

  • The team is already familiar with this product
  • The team already has this product
  • The button is able to be placed flexibly due to its size.
  • Quite cheap
  • The button must be positioned well, due to its small dimensions
Solution Pros Cons

Option 2 SWITCH TACTILE SPST-NO 0.05A 24V $0.14/ each Link to product

  • Has a high voltage capacity
  • Similar setup to the button the team is familiar with
  • The large profile of the button makes it harder to place
Solution Pros Cons

Option 3 CKN12221-1-ND $0.14/ each Link to product

  • The flush button makes it easier to put on the finished product
  • The price decreases as more are bought, so it is good for bulk purchases
  • The button is unlike the one the team is familiar with

Choice: Option 1: TS02-66-43-BK-260-LCR-D Rationale: Since this button is the most familiar, and the size is fairly small, it will likely be the best, saving on the time and money needed to purchase and ship it, while also being small enough to be placed flexibly on the finished product.

Primary power supply

Solution Pros Cons

Option 1 ALITOVE 12V 5A $12.99/ each Link to product

  • The power supply fits into a wall outlet
  • The DC power jack fits with the other parts the team has used well.
  • The addition of another power head can allow the team to be more flexible after designing
  • 5A does not quite reach the stall current of the motor
  • It may be more bulky than necessary for our product.
Solution Pros Cons

Option 2 1286-1213-ND $7.99/ each Link to product

  • Good voltage and current rating for the project
  • Multiple suppliers
  • Somewhat expensive shipping
  • Does not include wall outlet adapter
Solution Pros Cons

Option 3 Generic 12V 3A $4.99/ each Link to product

  • Cheap and easy to order
  • Not enough current for full motor stall
  • Variable quality of generic adapters

Choice: Option 1: ALITOVE 12V 5A Rationale: The DC power jack connector and the ability to switch the connection type is the most useful, combined with being the cheapest option out of the potential choices. Additionally, the Amperage should be fine, as the motor should never stall in its intended application.

Part Name/Description Qty Unit Cost Total Cost Manufacture Manufacturer # Vendor Link Datasheet Link Schematic Reference Designators 8-bit SIPO/SISO Shift Register, SOIC-16 package 1 $0.49 $ 0.49 NXP 74HC595D,112 DigiKey datasheet link U1 0.1 µF Ceramic Capacitor, +/-10%, X7R, 50V, 0805 package 10 0.2750 $2.75 KEMET C0805F104K5RACTU PRLTA 109 n/a C2, C4, C6, C7, C8, C9, C10, C11, C12, C16

Note: Setting it up as a table is nice because it is completely viewable without scaling issues. Downside is that you have to do the math.

  • You could also import your BOM via a screenshot of the spreadsheet created BOM

docs.title: Appendix - Charts Example
docs.text:
graph LR
  A[Start] --> B{Error?};
  B -->|Yes| C[Hmm...];
  C --> D[Debug];
  D --> B;
  B ---->|No| E[Yay!];
sequenceDiagram
  autonumber
  Alice->>John: Hello John, how are you?
  loop Healthcheck
      John->>John: Fight against hypochondria
  end
  Note right of John: Rational thoughts!
  John-->>Alice: Great!
  John->>Bob: How about you?
  Bob-->>John: Jolly good!
stateDiagram-v2
  state fork_state <<fork>>
    [*] --> fork_state
    fork_state --> State2
    fork_state --> State3

    state join_state <<join>>
    State2 --> join_state
    State3 --> join_state
    join_state --> State4
    State4 --> [*]

docs.title: Appendix - Example Controller Table for the ESP32
docs.text:
ESP Info Answer Help Model ? Include the entire part number (leave off any letters at the end that specify the package type) Product Page URL ? Found on Espressif.com ESP32-S3-WROOM-1-N4 Datasheet URL ? Do not paste links directly into the table. Use a link ESP32 S3 Datasheet URL ? Has more detail on functions ESP32 S3 Technical Reference Manual URL ? Has details on I/O multiplexing, USB, and others Vendor link ? Digikey, Jameco, etc. Do not paste links directly into the table. Use a link Code Examples ? url(s) for libraries on github or other sites related to the microcontroller and your planned peripherals External Resources URL(s) ? Search on Google and YouTube for other resources for each specific microcontroller. Unit cost ? Find on Digikey, Jameco, MPJA, or octopart Absolute Maximum Current for entire IC ? Find in the microcontroller datasheet Supply Voltage Range ? Min / Nominal / Max / Absolute Max, as found in datasheet Absolute Maximum current (for entire IC) ? as found in datasheet Maximum GPIO current (per pin) ? as found in datasheet Supports External Interrupts? ? as found in datasheet Required Programming Hardware, Cost, URL ? as found in datasheet Module # Available Needed Associated Pins (or * for any) UART ? ? ? external SPI* ? ? ? I2C ? ? ? GPIO ? ? ? ADC ? ? ? LED PWM ? ? ? Motor PWM ? ? ? USB Programmer ? 1 ? ...

* The ESP32-S2 has multiple SPI interfaces, but some are for internal use
